intro: Rhynchospora rubra, commonly known as the redroot spikegrass, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its erect, slender stems and small, reddish-purple flowers that bloom in summer. Its roots are reddish in color, giving the plant its common name. Rhynchospora rubra typically grows in wetlands and moist soils, making it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
